summary: The Fight for the American Dream Act (H.R. 4316) amends existing laws to potentially allow certain aliens, specifically those with employment authorization documents under the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) policy, to enlist in the Armed Forces. It also modifies naturalization procedures for individuals serving in the military, streamlining the process for those in the Selected Reserve or on active duty. The bill seeks to expand eligibility for military service and adjust related citizenship pathways.
